SENT.plain: Information generated by sensors that collect a patient's vital signals are continuous and unlimited data sequences
Traditionally, this information requires special equipment and programs to monitor them
These programs process and react to the continuous entry of data from different origins
Thus, the purpose of this study is to analyze the data produced by these biomedical devices, in this case the electrocardiogram (ECG)
Processing uses a neural classifier, Kohonen competitive neural networks, detecting if the ECG shows any cardiac arrhythmia
In fact, it is possible to classify an ECG signal and thereby detect if it is exhibiting or not any alteration, according to normality
